text: David John Finney (3 January 1917 â€“ 12 November 2018), was a British statisticianThe Royal Society and Professor Emeritus of Statistics at the University of Edinburgh. He was born in Latchford, Warrington. He was Director of the Agricultural Research Council's Unit of Statistics from 1954 to 1984 and a former President of the Royal Statistical Society and of the Biometric Society. He was known for the development of systematic monitoring of drugs for detection of adverse reactions. Finney turned 100 in January 2017David Finney celebrates 100th birthday by McDonnell, S. Significance April 2017 and died on 12 November 2018 at the age of 101 following a short illness. ==References== Category:1917 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Academics of the University of Edinburgh Category:British centenarians Category:British statisticians
title: D. J. Finney
